text: Ripon College is a private liberal arts college in Ripon, Wisconsin, United States. As of 2024, it has 754 undergraduate students. Most of the students are from Wisconsin. The college was made in 1851. It was originally named Brockway College. == History == The college opened in 1851, but no students went there until 1853. It was originally named Brockway College because a man named William S. Brockway gave 25 dollars to the college in 1851. The first class of students, which was four women, graduated in 1867. The college worked with with local Christian churches until 1868, and now it is not religious. The National Forensic League was started at the college in 1925. == References == == Other websites== * * Athletics website Category:1851 establishments in the United States Category:1850s establishments in Wisconsin Category:Colleges and universities in Wisconsin
title: Ripon College (Wisconsin)
